name: Toilet Table
description: Toilet Table; Attributed to Jean-François Leleu (French, 1729 - 1807, master 1764); Paris, France; about 1760 - 1765; Oak veneered with bloodwood, tulipwood, maple, spindle tree wood, walnut, amaranth and holly; gilt-bronze mounts; 70.2 x 56.8 x 40.3 cm (27 5/8 x 22 3/8 x 15 7/8 in.); 72.DA.49; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
title: Toilet Table
medium: Oak veneered with bloodwood, tulipwood, maple, spindle tree wood, walnut, amaranth and holly; gilt-bronze mounts
